item.title: 中国气候专家对提前达到排放峰值更有信心
item.description: 由于新清洁能源项目的大量涌现，中国气候专家对中国提前数年达到 2030 年碳排放峰值的目标越来越有信心。【原文：Chinese climate experts have grown more confident the nation will peak carbon emissions years ahead of the government’s 2030 target due to a flood of new clean energy projects.】

item.title: 贝莱德支持的新西兰太阳能公司停止运营
item.description: 新西兰贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：SolarZero, a New Zealand company owned by BlackRock Inc. that supports solar panel installations on residential homes, has been placed into liquidation.】

item.title: 120 亿美元气候基金准备发行罕见债券
item.description: 由于各国政府不愿提供削减全球排放量所需的额外资金，一个多边气候基金正准备首次进入资本市场。【原文：A multilateral climate fund is preparing to access capital markets for the first time, as governments balk at providing the extra financing needed to cut global emissions.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，道达尔暂停纽约海上风电场计划
item.description: 由于美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普誓言要阻挠其前任倡导的绿色产业，道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）已停止开发其计划在纽约海岸建造的海上风电场。【原文：TotalEnergies SE has halted the development of an offshore wind farm it plans to build off the coast of New York, as US President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to obstruct the green industry championed by his predecessor.】

item.title: 智利能源部长愿意推迟有争议的定价改革
item.description: 智利政府愿意撤销一项会侵蚀可再生能源行业部分利润的措施，但承诺日后将重新审查针对小型发电企业的规定。【原文：Chile’s government is willing to withdraw a measure that would have eaten into profits for a segment of the renewable energy industry, but is pledging to review the rules for small electricity generators at a later date.】

item.title: 特朗普和人工智能发电热潮正危及公用事业的气候目标
item.description:
一些美国公用事业公司表示，数据中心需求的不断增长意味着化石燃料的需求时间将更长

。【原文：

Some US utilities say rising demand from data centers means fossil fuels will be needed for longer

】

item.title: COP29 最后一刻达成的 3000 亿美元协议是一个烂摊子，也是一个奇迹
item.description:
丹麦首相梅特-弗雷德里克森（Mette Frederiksen）在本周的Zero节目中说："目标和指标是一回事，但实现目标是下一件事。【原文：

“Goals and targets are one thing, but delivering is the next thing,” Mette Frederiksen, prime minister of Denmark, says on this week’s Zero. 

】

item.title: 阿联酋首次考虑欧盟式处罚污染者计划
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国正在考虑引入污染收费机制，这将巩固其在应对气候变化方面的地区领导者地位。【原文：The United Arab Emirates is weighing the introduction of a pollution-charging mechanism, which would cement its position as a regional leader in the fight against climate change.】

item.title: 衰退的美国海上风电产业将新一代初创企业送往海外
item.description:
虽然 Aikido Technologies 刚刚在美国水域部署了首个浮动平台，但那里的市场似乎越来越不受欢迎。【原文：

Though Aikido Technologies has just deployed its first floating platform in US waters, the market there appears increasingly unappealing.

】

item.title: 主权债务为绿色投资者带来困境
item.description:
64万亿美元的全球市场在很大程度上不欢迎注重可持续发展的投资，但也难以避免。【原文：

The $64 trillion global market is largely inhospitable to sustainability-minded investing, but also hard to avoid.

】

item.title: 丹麦中央银行称部分贷款人面临二氧化碳税风险
item.description: 丹麦哥本哈根中央银行表示，丹麦对农业排放征税的计划将导致该国部分金融机构的减值费用上升，但不会威胁金融稳定。【原文：Denmark’s plan to tax agriculture emissions will lead to rising impairment charges for some of the nation’s financial institutions but won’t threaten financial stability, the central bank in Copenhagen said.】

item.title: 据说 TPG 正在就收购西门子歌美飒印度资产进行深入谈判
item.description: 据知情人士透露，TPG 公司正在就收购西门子能源公司 Gamesa 部门的印度风能资产进行深入谈判。【原文：TPG Inc. is in advanced talks to buy the Indian wind energy assets of Siemens Energy AG’s Gamesa unit, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 研究发现：富裕国家无法为气候厄运提供避风港
item.description: 随着关注气候变化的主权债务投资者对各国应对全球气温上升的措施进行仔细审查，他们越来越多地发现，较富裕的国家并没有为解决全球变暖问题尽自己的一份力量。【原文：As sovereign debt investors concerned about climate change scrutinize national responses to rising global temperatures, they’re increasingly finding that wealthier nations aren’t doing their part to help address global warming.】

item.title: 拜登为谷物带输电线路提供 49 亿美元融资
item.description: 拜登政府正在为横跨堪萨斯州至密苏里州的高压输电线路项目提供 49 亿美元的有条件贷款担保。【原文：The Biden administration is offering a $4.9 billion conditional loan guarantee for a high-voltage transmission line project spanning Kansas to Missouri.】

item.title: 摩根大通寻求交易为关闭燃煤发电提供资金
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is actively pursuing deals to finance the early shutdown of coal-fired power plants, joining a list of global banks that are rethinking their approach to handling the world’s dirtiest fossil fuel.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯如何在 COP29 上逆转气候进展
item.description:
石油巨头在确保主要成果中没有一项要求各国放弃化石燃料方面发挥了关键作用。【原文：

The oil giant was crucial in making sure none of the major outcomes called for nations to move away from fossil fuels.

】

item.title: 特朗普团队准备尽早采取行动结束拜登的液化天然气暂停计划
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的过渡团队正在起草一份行政命令，以取消拜登政府暂停天然气出口许可的规定。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s transition team is crafting an executive order to lift a moratorium on natural gas export permits that was put in place by the Biden administration, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 飓风频发的马拉维首次采用储能技术加强电网建设
item.description: 马拉维正在建设其首个电池能源系统，这项技术将有助于保护其电网免受近年来袭击非洲南部国家的气旋的影响。【原文：Malawi is building its first battery-energy system, a technology that will help protect its grid from cyclones that have battered the southern African nation in recent years.】

item.title: 电动汽车电池制造商呼吁欧盟采用更廉价能源对抗中国
item.description: 欧盟最大的电动汽车电池工厂的韩国业主呼吁欧盟降低能源成本，在来自中国的激烈竞争中发展这一战略性产业。【原文：The South Korean owner of the European Union’s largest factory of electric-vehicle batteries called on the bloc to reduce energy costs and grow the strategic industry amid stiff competition from China.】

item.title: 纽约市的 "活防波堤 "为风暴海域做好准备
item.description:
景观建筑师凯特-奥尔夫（Kate Orff）在斯塔顿岛（Staten Island）外设计了独特的海岸线保护装置，既能防止洪水泛滥，又能提供新的珊瑚礁栖息地。【原文：

Landscape architect Kate Orff’s unique shoreline protection device off Staten Island is designed to both prevent flooding and provide a new reef habitat.

】

item.title: 欧盟在日益激烈的反弹中寻求简化 ESG 法规
item.description: 下一届欧盟委员会将紧急寻求精简集团的众多环境、社会和治理规则，以回应有关过度监管削弱行业竞争力的抱怨。【原文：The next European Commission will urgently seek to streamline the bloc’s many environmental, social and governance rules, as it responds to complaints that excessive regulations are gutting industry competitiveness.】

item.title: 日本专家小组建议 2035 年减排 60% 的目标
item.description: 根据周一举行的政府小组会议，日本决策者建议设定到 2035 年减排 60% 的目标。【原文：Japanese policymakers suggested setting a target of cutting emissions by 60% by 2035, according to a government panel held Monday.】

item.title: COP29 最后一刻达成 3000 亿美元交易背后的故事
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将带您了解 COP29 如何从濒临崩溃的边缘走向达成 3,000 亿美元的协议。然后，我们将展望全球气候谈判的下一个时刻：在韩国釜山开始讨论全球塑料条约。如需了解我们的更多报道，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter gives you a behind-the-scenes look at how COP29 went from the brink of collapse to a $300 billion deal. Then, we look ahead to the next moment in global climate negotiations — talks toward a global plastic treaty as discussions begin in Busan, South Korea. For more of our coverage, please subscribe.】

item.title: 暴风雨伯特给英国大片地区带来洪水和混乱
item.description: 暴风雪伯特在英国各地留下了破坏痕迹，威尔士和英格兰西部发布了数百个洪水警报。【原文：Storm Bert left a trail of disruption across the UK, with hundreds of flood warnings in place for Wales and the west of England.】

item.title: 暴风雪 "贝尔特 "继续造成重大交通中断和洪水预警
item.description: 继上周末 "毁灭性 "的洪水之后，暴风雪伯特又带来了大范围的混乱，公共交通受到严重影响。【原文：Storm Bert is bringing further widespread disruption with public transport badly affected after "devastating" flooding over the weekend.】

item.title: 南部非洲国家遭遇多年来最严重停电事故
item.description: 津巴布韦电力公司（Zimbabwe Power Co.【原文：Zimbabwe and neighboring Zambia were plunged into darkness on Sunday because of a fault that Zimbabwe Power Co. said affected both southern African countries.】

item.title: 印度希望与日本和新加坡达成碳交易
item.description: 印度的目标是在 2025 年初与日本敲定一项潜在的碳信用协议，然后与韩国和新加坡等国推进类似的谈判。【原文：India is aiming to finalize a potential carbon credit deal with Japan early in 2025 and then advance similar negotiations with nations including South Korea and Singapore】

item.title: 世界能否团结起来，结束塑料污染危机？
item.description:
随着全球塑料条约的最后一次谈判在韩国拉开帷幕，各国在是否对这种无处不在的材料设定生产上限的问题上出现了分歧。【原文：

As the last negotiations for a global plastic treaty begin in South Korea, countries are divided over whether to cap production of the ubiquitous material. 

】

item.title: 以代价挽救 COP29 会谈的疯狂策略内幕
item.description:
为期两周的艰难谈判濒临失败，最终达成了一项价值 3,000 亿美元的协议，为气候外交的未来发出了警告。【原文：

Two weeks of difficult negotiations came to the brink of failure before settling on a $300 billion deal that flashes warnings for the future of climate diplomacy.

】

item.title: 特朗普获胜迫使华尔街一度声势浩大的一角重整旗鼓
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，迫使华尔街一个术语较多的角落重新思考其谈话要点。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is forcing one of Wall Street’s more jargon-filled corners to rethink its talking points.】
